made him feel ashamed of himself, he said, as if merely asking his fa- 
ther to let him have the carriage to drive to town: 
"Papa, I have come on a matter of business. I was nearly forgetting. I need some money." 
"Dear me!" said his father, who was in a spe- cially good humor. "I told you it would not be enough. How much?" 
"Very much," said Nicholas flushing, and with a stupid careless smile, for which he was long unable to forgive himself, "I have lost a little, I mean a good deal, a g
